summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-first Avenue South, from one hundred twenty (120) feet north of Plum Street to Rainier Avenue, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary wyes, openings, manholes, flush tanks, catch basins and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 746 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
